Job Title: Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst
Job Description:
Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst

Pemex Deer Parkis a highly complex refinery located 18 miles east of Houston in Deer Park, TX. It is part of the Pemex group, a fully integrated oil company in the Americas, working across the entire value chain: exploration, production, industrial processing/refining, logistics, and marketing. The refinery’s rated capacity is 340,000 barrels per day and has the feed flexibility to process multiple grades of crudes to produce the high-quality transportation fuels the world needs. The Pemex site is co-located with other 3rd party chemical facilities, allowing for further integration and optimization of the refinery and its products. Pemex Deer Park provides a diverse and inclusive work environment that employs approximately 1000 employees with another 1000 contractors on site. We set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors and offer challenging and fulfilling job opportunities in a number of fields. We take great pride in our ability to ensure the health and safety of our workers and the environment while being a good neighbor and having a positive impact on the local community where we work.

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation depending on experience and an extensive benefits package including:

Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided.
Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching.
Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection.
Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts are offered.
Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and 9/80 Flexible Working Schedule, including limited ability to work remotely.

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

We seek a Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst who will support the IT Enterprise Digital Solutions Manager to drive alignment between IT and the business. Your role will include working with a variety of teams leading activities and projects related to RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics. Your objective is to find daily continuous improvement opportunities, including understanding their business processes, requirements, and use of each application. As the Business Systems Analyst, you will assist in project planning, coordination with vendors, and follow-up on support efforts our remote support teams are giving. From a site perspective, you will link the business and our different IT teams, translating business needs into technical solutions. You will also establish IT Application best practices at the site. We expect you to seek to understand the Refinery business and oil and Gas practices and feel comfortable working in a Plant-type environment. Creativity and customer-centric attitudes are fundamental in this role.

To be successful, you must have:

Understanding of common applications used at a Refinery
Understanding of applications and processes where Value can be created
Strong technical abilities in application design, configuration, implementation, and support
Should have working knowledge of RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centred Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics
Understanding of standard business processes in a Refinery or the Oil & Gas industry
Understanding of key ‘pain points’ in typical IT Applications environment
Ease / Proficiency in understanding complex business processes and translating them into technical solutions.
Experience developing “how to use” type documents
Experience creating an applications inventory and portfolio
Team leadership skills: able to lead, communicate, and interact with offsite Support teams
Experience having worked in similar roles or environments
Comfortable working at a Refinery or have worked in similar type plants.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) among IT, digital, and business stakeholders
Comfortable in a multi-tasking type environment

Preferred Experience in the following software:

Operator Technical Monitoring (Intellatrac / Aveva – Mobile Operator)

Your responsibilities as the Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst will include:

Stakeholder Management

Interacts with business stakeholders, their engagements/projects, understanding needs and / or requirements
Represents Health, Safety, Security, and Environmental team needs to be incorporated into the overall Enterprise Architecture
Handles and manages a portfolio of Applications within the mentioned Teams
Actively participate in Business and IT team discussions, bringing in best practices to and from the site

Value Generation & Protection

Maintain & support portfolio of Applications
Define when to purchase (OTS), use current application, or internal development.
Work with businesses to define and document business processes
Lead any new application projects, deployments, and enhancement
Contribute to the creation of knowledge-based articles used for Support
Lead the offsite Applications Support teams
Vendor management and engagement
Contract management, license management
Understand, plan, and deploy application upgrades/patches
Contribute to budget management for Applications – control spend
Definition/control of Application Support Desk KPIs
Define / Modify end-user service model – escalations, levels of service, feedback from end users
Contribute to IT communications – prepare and communicate for specific applications working with IT Operations lead
IT Policies and procedures – define, deploy, and enforce the correct use of applications.
Interact with all IT Teams – coordinating daily activities and projects

Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Skills / Requirements

The Epic Business Systems Lead Analyst ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Systems Department. This role supports the Epic applications deployed within the Harris Health System.

Management Experience: Two (2) years of EPIC Project Team Lead experience.

Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact), Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking), Writing / Correspondence, Writing / Reports

Experience supporting an Electronic Medical Record System.
Healthcare Information Technology experience.
Understanding of functional processes and business rules related to the applications being implemented/supported.
Ability to handle multiple activities simultaneously, be able to prioritize effectively, and meet overlapping deadlines.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Incident Management Analyst (more daily event management) has a major role in managing ITSM processes based on ITIL best practices. Successful candidates will be focused on core IT Service Management/ITIL functions but not limited to areas such as Incident Management, Service Level Management, etc. The Incident Management Analyst will ensure that standardized methods and procedures (ITIL v4) are used for efficient and prompt handling of all incidents in order to minimize the impact of incidents on service quality and delivery. The Incident Management Analyst will be instrumental in identifying opportunities to improve day-to-day operations of the organization.

Proactive review of the environment – review for trends/work with service owners/bigger issue that warrants the creation of a ticket.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determines, analyzes and formulates current practices, user needs and workflow processes, issues and potential solutions.

Obtains relevant data/information.

Analyzes, aggregates, assimilates, and validates data/information.

Coordinates resources assigned to complete projects. Includes managing and coordinating data, information and/or personnel.

Analyzes project impacts and dependencies across the IS organization.

Recommends process changes as determined from risk and failure points in the processes evaluated, with necessary modifications to workflows and/or current procedures to maximize the advantages of existing systems.

Analysis of current business practices, user needs and workflow processes.

Develop training programs and materials/documentation for all user types.

In the event of an outage, incident or emergency, ensures all Incident Management processes are adhered to. Making sure tickets are being generated/ parent/child tied correctly/ documentation accurate PREFERRED – experience with SNOW major incident module

Incident investigation and diagnosis.

Detection of possible problems and the assignment to the Problem Management team.
Participation in audit activities related to the Incident Management process.
Responsible for Incident Management reporting.
Collaborates with IS Leadership and IS Executive teams in driving service management best practice and ITIL process standardization.
Ability to create and deliver Executive Level reports based on ticket analysis. Pulling dashboard from SNOW to share with leaders
Identify areas of opportunities and recommend improvements in the execution of the process.
Continuous development and daily management of Service Quality.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Experience with SNOW dashboard – weekly aging report, working within SNOW to review tickets, looking at tickets that are nt being updated. Looking at incidents that are being re-assigned multiple times. Dig into the WHY. Opportunity to improve KA?
Monitor tickets for incorrect priority – just “watch the queue” real time
Ability to look at “what drove the tickets”
Knows difference between INCIDENT and SERVICE REQUESTS
Well rounded experience with incident management and how it all FITS TOGETHER
Participate in testing of new SNOW modules/upgrades
Take the data and TELL A STORY… what does it all mean?

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Excellent communicator with strong facilitation and soft skills.
Strong social, interpersonal skills, customer-centric attitude and ability to deal with highly complex and high pressured situations.
Analytical skills. Must possess the ability to understand business processes and workflows.
Ability to liaise with executive-level sponsors.
Ability to work well under pressure.
Flexible and adapts to rapid change.
Working knowledge of ServiceNow and other ticket systems.
Ability to logically analyze problems and develop efficient and effective solutions.
Ability to compile and analyze data, identify patterns, trends and problems, make recommendations for improvement, and prepare reports for management review.
Ability to plan, assign, and direct the work of others.
Ability to perform work requiring close attention to detail.
Ability to establish and maintain satisfactory relationships with other departments, employees, and the general public using courtesy, patience, and tact.
Verbal and written communication skills, planning, analytical and problem solving skills.
Good customer service skills required and ability to work well in a team environment.

About NW

NW aims to make the energy transition accessible to all. Since 2007, the group has been deploying innovative solutions to increase the share of low-carbon energies in the French electricity mix, support the stability of the electricity network and contributing to the development of electric mobility.

As the first French energy transition unicorn, NW is the leader in France in electricity storage with its JBox solution and the precursor of high-power charging terminals, its IECharge. The company is also expanding internationally, particularly in Europe and the United States. In February 2023, NW joined the FrenchTech Next40.

Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently

Curiosity and enthusiasm for technical subjects, particularly related to the energy grid

Your profile

Why NW?

At Enbridge, our goal is to be the first-choice energy delivery company in North America and beyond—for customers, communities, investors, regulators and policymakers, and employees.

To meet that goal, Enbridge is partnering with Raise—a leading recruitment firm that specializes in IT, Technical, and Engineering staffing.

Together, Raise and Enbridge are building teams that are rising to meet the growing energy needs of North America. If you’re looking for a challenging role that will make the most of your skills while allowing you to make an impact, this is it.

Enbridge is hiring a Business Analyst right now—when you apply, Raise will review your application within 48 hours and contact qualified applicants for interviews.


Description

The role is responsible for meeting the Program Development Office’s project objectives, completing deliverables, and developing business processes. The IM Business Analyst serves as a liaison to functional Business Leads to translate and prioritize business requirements for GTM Operations business process optimization projects throughout the project lifecycle. The skillset should be interchangeable between different types of GTMO projects, while also assisting the IM supervisor with ad-hoc and special project work.

The IM Business Analyst reports directly to the IM Supervisor and supports the IM Process Specialist. From a project perspective, the IM Business Analyst has a dotted line report to the IM Project Managers in which they are assigned to. The IM Business Analyst is accountable for working with all GTM program owners (inclusive of Business Sponsors and Business Leads), stakeholders, and enterprise services to help identify project interdependencies.


Key Responsibilities

Indirect report to the Project Manager to assist with project scope definition and provide business analysis support throughout the project lifecycle.
May assist the Project Manager with project management tasks as needed, scheduling, documentation, issues, change requests, status, etc.
Strong writing skills to prepare business cases, current state (as-is) and future state (to be) analysis, process flow mapping, RACI and RAPID model, business process optimization recommendations, workshop facilitations, and training content.
Assists the business in identifying proper controls, recommendations for automation, and understands integration with other interdependent programs.
Responsible for preparing business requirements (business rules, business/functional/technical) specifications and managing requests for changes to the specifications.
Maintains functional peer relationships and detailed working knowledge of the assigned areas systems, organization, and business processes.
Can act as a cross functional Business Analyst to support multiple areas of the business such as asset management, pipeline integrity, facility integrity, work management, compliance, etc.


Criteria & Qualifications

Business Analyst certification, related degree and/or a minimum of 10 years related experience within the oil and gas industry
Must have oil and gas experience with Field Operations project support
Understanding of project lifecycle stage gating controls and importance of document and records management
Ability to support, adapt to change quickly, and move across various types of projects when needed
Excellent writing skills, problem solving skills, interpersonal skills, oral communication skills, and time management
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office products, especially Visio, Teams, and MS Project
Ability to influence and negotiate with clients and 3rd party vendors
Proficient at operating within a North Americanly distributed team


Please note: Successful applicants will be employees of Raise, working at Enbridge facilities with both Enbridge and contract employees.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
The GIS Analyst provides a support role within the Office of The City Engineer (OCE) supporting users of the City’s Geographic Information System.

Responsibilities:
Utilizes ESRI ArcGIS software to create, maintain, and update geospatial data pertaining to assets within the City’s right-of-way.
Creates maps, reports, and runs analyses as needed for OCE.
Provides OCE with assistance and training for the City’s web mapping application, GeoLink.
Analyzes data sources, problem-solves, and suggests solutions for the future.
Converts data from one software platform to another.
Geocodes data files; enters, corrects, and modifies data.
Communicates with various teams and permit applicants.

WORKING CONDITIONS
There are occasional minor discomforts from exposure to less-than-optimal temperature and air conditions. The position may involve dealing with modestly unpleasant situations, as with occasional exposure to office chemicals and/or extensive use of a video display terminal.

This is a Houston Public Works Emergency Management position at the Tier III Level.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
Requires an Bachelor's degree in Geographic Information Science, Planning, Geography, Computer Science, or a closely related field.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
No experience required.

Substitution: Professional experience working with a comprehensive geographic information system may be substituted for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis.

LICENSE REQUIREMENTS
None

PREFERENCES

Preferences will be given to applicants that have knowledge of coordinate geometry software, GPS and conventional surveying technology and data collection software.

Preference may be given to candidates with excellent communication skills and superior customer service attributes.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst (NOT A REMOTE OPPORTUNITY - this role is located in our offices in Houston, Texas)
Job Description:
Business Intelligence Data Analyst




Company: Spark Energy




Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst




Location: Houston, Texas (NOT a remote opportunity)




Department: Analytics & Strategic Projects




Reports to: Manager, Business Intelligence




FLSA Status: Exempt




JOB SUMMARY

The primary purpose of the Business Intelligence Data Analyst role is to assist management in making informed business decisions based on the output of the data warehouse by mining for important facts and statistics within the data that help render a true picture of the organization’s performance. Key to this role is the ability to extract and manipulate complex data from multiple sources and systems and synthesize the results into clear dashboards and presentations to monitor the performance of our business. The ideal candidate will have a background doing quantitative and qualitative analysis on transactional and financial data within an Energy company; be comfortable with large and complex data sets and be adept at preparing intelligent dashboards, metrics and reports to drive exceptional business insights.




SUMMARY OF ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Implementation and ownership of an internal data governance program
High degree of initiative and enthusiasm about data and the ability to derive value from data
Collect past and present data to establish trends within the organizational data
Analyze existing data to develop projections of the outcomes of implementing certain business strategies based on historical data
Analyze existing data with an eye for identifying and resolving anomalies or inconsistencies within the data
Implementation of a data quality standard and plan for the data warehouse
Ability to collaborate effectively with the BI team and end users to define and mine the right data sources efficiently and accurately
Proficient SQL skills and mastery of Excel
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results
Strong verbal and written communications skills that enable you to explain complex insights with clarity and precision
Work with third party vendors to reconcile data integration points on a regular basis
Create high-impact and compelling visuals to present metrics and findings to management and colleagues
Experience in managing large complicated data sets and integrating disparate sources of data into a databases or data warehouse for ease of reporting and analysis
Strong communication & presentation skills (verbal and written) with executive-level reporting experience



MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS




3+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a company with large, complex data sources
Experience with database tools and SQL Server 2008/2012 is required
Experience with Tableau or a comparable analytics platform is preferred
Experience with large, raw data sets is required
Retail energy industry experience preferred
Exhibit a professional and positive attitude
Adapt readily to change
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Self-motivated, results oriented individual
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, problem solving, written, and verbal communication skills
Perform well in a fast-paced, deadline and detail-oriented work environment
Successfully execute many complex tasks simultaneously
Knowledge and ability to facilitate meetings, conduct effective briefings and presentations and to develop consensus both internal and externally

ABILITIES REQUIRED




Ability to meet highest attendance requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
Ability to use personal computer, calculator, etc.
Could involve some lifting up to 20 pounds.
Ability to sit for extended periods of time without much movement.
Ability to work in time-sensitive environment with non-flexible deadlines.

[Houston]


The following posting is a pipeline requisition, meant to accumulate candidates for 2024. Qualified applicants will be contacted in concert with the approval and publication of identical, approved positions within HP, Inc.

Candidates who identify with a group that is historically underrepresented in the technology sector including by not limited to, African American, Latino, Native American, individuals with disabilities and Veterans are encouraged to apply.


About Us

Innovation is in HP’s DNA. From our origins in a Palo Alto garage in 1939, to our current position as one of the world’s leading technology companies, HP has grown to become a leader in technology and corporate culture, inspiring innovators, and entrepreneurs around the globe.


HP brings together a portfolio that spans printing, personal computing, software, and services to serve more than 1 billion customers in over 170 countries. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace that attracts exceptional talent and to supporting our employees to succeed at all levels. We dream in over 35 languages and share one mission: to engineer experiences that amaze.


The Program:

Our future success depends on the innovation and fresh ideas you bring to HP, Inc. We are hiring students and new graduates with a diverse set of skills and experiences to join us, across the different organizations that make us HP, Inc. Our new grad program is intended to help you learn and grow at HP, give you an opportunity to make an impact, and work with leading edge technology. At HP, you’ll use advanced tools and technology to tackle complex challenges that make a real impact on people’s lives.


The Team:

Finance is committed to helping build a Future Ready HP by delivering business results, driving transformation, and developing our people. Finance is a strategic partner to the business and plays an integrated role by providing insights that guide business decisions and support HP’s corporate goals.


In addition to traditional operations such as accounting, reporting, tax, audit and treasury, HP Finance leverages technology and data analytics to gather, analyze, and interpret financial and operational data. This data-driven approach allows for more accurate forecasting, risk assessment, and performance measurement, leading to better decision-making across the organization, positioning HP for long-term success and helping to accelerate growth.


Responsibilities:

As a Finance Data Analyst, you will work with a team to:


Provide financial analysis for a function or business.

Use advanced analytical techniques to extract insights and knowledge from data.

Translate complex data sets into actionable insights that drive informed decision-making and business strategies.

Apply business intelligence and reporting tools (e.g., creation of interactive dashboards).

Utilize process mining tools to improve process performance.

Works with the team to creates stories with the data using visualization tools/methods.

Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.

Develop an understanding of HP's financial processes and a working knowledge of the business.


Education and Experience Required (Objective Minimum Qualifications)


Have no more than 12 months of prior work experience professionally related to the Graduate Hire Requisition they are applying to, (not including internships, teaching assistance, research work, or military experience).

Will have completed at least your bachelor’s degree prior to your anticipated start date with HP.

Able to obtain work authorization in the United States without requiring sponsorship in the future.


Preferred Knowledge and Skills (Preferred Qualifications):

Preferred majors include (but are not limited to) Computer Science, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

Basic understanding of accounting processes.

Understanding of scientific design and data collection methodologies, tools, and analysis packages to collect, validate, and analyze research data.

Good analytical and problem-solving skills.

Good business application skills (e.g., Microsoft Office suite).

Good written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to effectively communicate research plans, proposals, and results.

Familiarity of industry standard languages such as Python.

Familiarity of tools like RStudio, PowerBI, and Tableau for visualization.

Familiarity of industry leading forecasting tools such as Workday Adaptive, Anaplan, or Stratify.

Foundational understanding in data mining tools such as RStudio or Orange.

Familiarity with digital automation tools such as StudioX, UXPath, or SQL.

JOB SUMMARY
At Houston Methodist, the Data Analyst position is responsible for the provision of analytical support of data generated by the department. This position will assist in creating, designing and implementing processes to ensure accurate data collection and input. The Data Analyst position will assist with maintenance of department database and on-going training of end users. This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing and reporting statistical information and patient outcomes to both external and internal customers which may include statistical power and sample size determination, inferential hypothesis testing, algorithm development and numerical methods, data mining and knowledge discovery in databases. Reporting duties for the Data Analyst position will involve the provision of monthly departmental reports and ensuring timely regulatory reporting completion. Additional responsibilities for this position include making recommendations for the implementation of technology and processes required to support the goals of the department with emphasis on regulatory compliance. The Data Analyst position will complete or assign other data requests.




PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Job responsibilities labeled EF capture those duties that are essential functions of the job.

PEOPLE - 20%



Communicates results of queries in database systems and upgrades regarding electronic protocol management system to coworkers, staff and management. (EF)
Completes and works directly with physicians, clinical staff and management on customized data queries and other requests for operational and research needs. (EF)
Fosters teamwork approach in all interactions with peers and team members. Anticipates needs of other team members; proactively offering assistance. Provides contributions towards improvement of department scores for turnover/retention/employee engagement. (EF)

SERVICE - 30%

Provides troubleshooting logic in relation to technical support. (EF)
Provides and/or supervises gathering, entering and auditing of data in database. (EF)
Assists with design and implementation of processes to ensure accurate data collection and input. (EF)
Performs statistical analysis interpretation by preparing reports (monthly, quarterly and/or as needed) on productivity, quality activities, trends and other clinical or business metrics relevant to the department. (EF)

QUALITY/SAFETY - 15%

Conducts routine data processing and implementation of quality control methods. (EF)
Develops standard operating procedures. Ensures compliance with all HIPAA/confidentiality regulations. (EF)
In conjunction with management, participates in performance improvement program for department. (EF)

FINANCE - 20%

Conducts, as appropriate, statistical power and sample size determination, inferential hypothesis testing, data mining and knowledge discovery in databases. (EF)
Responsible for all aspects of clinical data analyses for multiple studies. (EF)
Programs and develops algorithms for numerical methods and develops workflow and data pipelines as needed for project(s). (EF)

GROWTH/INNOVATION - 15%

Collaborates with Technology regarding software system proposals, purchases, installations, upgrades, enhancements and modifications. (EF)
Identifies and assumes responsibility of own learning needs, consults with team experts and seeks continuing education opportunities to meet those needs. Completes and updates the individual development plan (IDP) on an on-going basis. Ensures own career discussions occur with appropriate management. (EF)

This job description is not intended to be all inclusive; the employee will also perform other reasonably related business/job duties as assigned. Houston Methodist reserves the right to revise job duties and responsibilities as the need arises.

Company Profile:

The Houston Methodist Academic Institute team science approach bridges the boundaries between medical specialties and research and development labs to advance the practice of medicine and population health. We innovate in health care delivery and technology by streamlining the path discoveries take into the clinic with inventive development and adoption practices. Our teams are also dedicated to training clinicians and researchers from around the world in translational medicine and advanced technology. Houston Methodist's primary academic affiliates are top-ranked Weill Cornell Medical College and the Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences for faculty appointments and graduate programs offered on our Houston campus. The Institute oversees 600,000 sq ft of dedicated space and the administrative and operational infrastructure for basic and applied research and clinical trials, including more than 20 advanced tech core facilities, extramural funding management, regulatory and legal strategy and compliance, and product development and commercialization. This infrastructure is fully integrated with our hospital systems and supports more than 50,000 learners, 700 faculty, 2000 credentialed researchers, 6,000 research projects and clinical trials that creates innovative breakthroughs in human disease and the practice of medicine every day.

About the Role
The Data Analyst position will manage and interpret data to support the execution and delivery of insurance products and services by delivering dashboards and detailed reports to ensure a better understanding of business results.

Description of Ideal Candidate

The individual will demonstrate an understanding of corporate finance areas, including revenue streams, expenses, cash flows, and capital.
Individual will be able to interpret and analyze results from data extractions to identify patterns and trends, including financial results.
Familiar with relational database development and administration and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
The Individual will have superior problem-solving and critical thinking skills and excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
The Individual will be able to prioritize and manage workflow and meet deadlines.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Set up and maintain reports and dashboards.
Build and maintain data warehouse, new, and ad hoc reports.
Perform analysis on product performance metrics (loss ratio, frequency, severity, hit ratio, retention, etc.)
Prepare important, timely, and accurate regulatory data submissions for the organization.
Develop reports and dashboards for use across the organization, collecting feedback and partnering with users to understand and deliver usable information.
Perform competitive pricing analysis, creating and leveraging large data sets.
Participate in the setup and testing of a new data and analytics platform.
Prepare monthly key performance metrics scorecard.
Synthesize current business trend data to support recommendations for action.
Provide analytical support by creating reports and applications to further drive data-driven decision-making.
Reconcile commission reports from carriers and develop detailed producer commission reports.
Utilize, rebuild, and improve current reporting infrastructure (MS Access, SQL, Excel, etc.) to utilize innovative technology and efficiencies.
Prepare ad-hoc reporting and applications for various functional areas within the organization.
Generate standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, or other stakeholders.
Uses data analysis and interpretation to develop conclusions and make recommendations, support decision-making, and identify trends and emerging issues.
Skills and Abilities

Advanced experience in Microsoft Excel, SQL, and business intelligent platforms such as Power BI.
Exceptional quantitative analytic capabilities.
Ability to extract and collect large data sets from and into various sources and formats.
Ability to apply proper data research methods and procedures.
Ability to identify data gaps, errors, anomalies, inconsistencies, and redundancies by analyzing content, structure, and relationships within data.
Employment Experience Qualification
Minimum

2-3 years of experience in corporate financial data analysis, modeling, and reporting.
Proven ability to analyze data and discover trends.
Proficient in Excel and QuickBooks.
Preferred
3-5 years of experience in corporate financial data analysis, modeling, and reporting in the Insurance Industry.

Educational Qualification Requirements
Minimum
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Finance, Statistics, Business or related field.

Preferred
Master’s degree in any of the fields listed above.

Work Environment
This position worked in a fast-paced office environment. It will require the ability to sit for extended periods and handle long periods of screen time and repetitive keyboard functions. The typical work schedule is Monday through Friday during regular business hours.

Overview:

RES is the nation’s largest ecological restoration company and a preeminent environmental mitigation bank developer. The Company follows a design/build, maintain, sustain, and steward approach and has the internal capabilities to lead a bank through each stage in the asset’s lifecycle.




Environmental mitigation is a core competency at RES and the Company has structured a centralized corporate group to lead RES’ continued investment in the banking space.




One of the group’s core functions is to identify and analyze environmental mitigation markets. The group’s Investments and Capital Allocation team is looking to hire a Data Analyst to build out and manage data analytics. The Data Analyst will report to the Head of Investments and Capital Allocation and will be responsible for all data-related activities that support mitigation bank investment decisions. The position will be based out of our headquarters in Houston, TX.

What your day-to-day might look like?:
Identify new sources of data and pathways to collect data from various sources (query databases, download data from APIs, acquire data from internal excel spreadsheets)
Clean, reprocess, and structure data; build and maintain databases that can be used by other non-technical stakeholders
Analyze data (run statistical analyses, build predictive models, perform hypothesis testing)
Create visualizations, such as charts, graphs, and dashboards; communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with RES’ operational teams to establish industry-specific data analytics opportunities
Collaborate with Hub teammates to integrate data analytics into investment decision-making


Main responsibilities that you will have to support the objectives and success of the team:

Identification of data sources (public and private)
Data collection: gather data from various sources, which may include public and private databases, internal spreadsheets, internal software systems such as NetSuite and Salesforce, web scraping, external APIs
Data cleaning, reprocessing, and structuring: clean and reprocess data to ensure accuracy and reliability; structure data to enable analysis
Data analysis: perform statistical analysis, data mining, and data modeling to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Data visualization: create clear and meaningful visual representations of data
Hypothesis testing: design and conduct hypothesis tests to validate assumptions and support decision-making
Report generation: prepare reports and presentations summarizing the results of data analysis and focusing on providing actionable insights
Data interpretation: interpret the results of data analysis in the context of business objectives and industry trends to make data-driven recommendations
Data quality assurance: ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by implementing data quality checks and validation procedures
Data monitoring: continuously monitor data sources and processes
Database management: build and maintain databases and data management systems to retrieve, update, and manipulate data


Key Skills, behaviors and knowledge that will make you successful:

Data acquisition and manipulation: proficient in retrieving, cleaning, and transforming data
Communication skills (written and oral): highly proficient in communicating solutions, findings, insights effectively to non-technical audiences; highly proficient in creating reports, dashboards, and presentations for senior management
Analytical skills and statistical knowledge: strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities; able to dissect complex data sets and extract meaningful insights; solid understanding of statistics and able to apply statistical techniques for data exploration, hypothesis testing, and modeling
Attention to detail: meticulous in the analysis and the visualization/reporting of the analysis
Teamwork: able to collaborate with non-technical stakeholders across a variety of functions
Adaptability: comfortable working in a constantly evolving environment
Interest in environmental markets


Qualifications:

Previous experience that will support your application:

3+ years-experience in data acquisition, management, and analytics (extracting, cleaning, structuring, analyzing)
Experience transitioning an organization from manual data extraction and disparate “warehousing” to automated data extraction, management, and analysis
Familiarity with data extraction from NetSuite, Salesforce, and other corporate management software applications

Recruitment Fraud

It has come to our attention various individuals and/or organizations are contacting people falsely pretending to recruit on behalf of Oxy. Please be aware that these recruiting scams and communications do not originate nor are they associated with our recruitment process.

Oxy does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruiting process. We will never:

Ask you to pay for applications, interviews, meetings, processing, training or for any other fees
Use recruiting or placement agencies that charge candidates an advance fee of any kind or
Request personal information such as passport and bank account details at an early stage of our recruitment process.

We recommend against responding to unsolicited business propositions or offers from people you don't know. Do not disclose your personal or financial details. If you believe you have been the victim of a recruiting scam, please contact your local police department.

Who is Eventellect?
Eventellect partners with professional and collegiate sports teams to unify their approach to single game ticket sales and transform it into a strategic business asset. With Eventellect, teams fairly value single game tickets, protect season ticket holders’ investment, and match the right audience with the right experience to maximize revenue, build fan loyalty and ensure team success. We are a fast-growing company that is respected both in Houston (Houston Business Journal’s Best Places to Work 2017, 2018, & 2022) and nationally (INC 5000 list of fastest-growing companies 10 years in a row).

What are we looking for?
Passionate and innovative individuals are what we seek for our Data Analyst positions, as they play a crucial role in unraveling complex data challenges and providing actionable insights. Data Analysts at our company are integral to the evolution of our analytics capabilities, and subsequently, the success of the organization. In our fast-paced environment, you’ll find ample opportunities for professional growth and influence.

Our culture thrives on collaboration, encouraging you to share your data-driven insights and learn from your peers daily. By bringing your unique perspective to the team, you contribute directly to shaping the strategies and decision-making processes across various departments. So, if you have a knack for transforming data into stories and strategies, and you thrive in a team-oriented setting, we would love to have you on board.

Qualifications
Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Mathematics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Business Intelligence Tools: Proven experience and strong proficiency with Business Intelligence tools for data visualization, reporting, and dashboard creation.
SQL Skills: Extensive experience in writing complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. Ability to optimize queries for performance.
Data Analysis: Demonstrated ability in analyzing large datasets, interpreting data trends, and providing actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly present data findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Python Experience: Familiarity with Python for data analysis, manipulation, and automation is a plus.
DBT and Snowflake Experience: Previous experience with DBT for data transformation and Snowflake as a data warehousing solution is a strong advantage.


Responsibilities

Work closely with stakeholders in Data Science, Ticket Strategy, Finance, and Operations to understand their data requirements: Develop strong relationships and maintain regular communication with key personnel in the Ticket Strategy, Finance, and Operations departments. Understand their specific data needs, challenges, and objectives to ensure that the data provided meets their expectations and supports their decision-making processes.
Organize, analyze, and visualize data to create actionable insights for different departments: Ensure that data is stored and categorized in an accessible and logical manner. Utilize various analytical techniques and visualization tools to interpret data trends, patterns, and anomalies. Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights that can be easily understood by departmental stakeholders.
Develop and maintain data models in Snowflake, ensuring data accuracy and availability: Build and refine data models within Snowflake, a cloud-based data warehousing solution. Ensure that data is accurate, consistent, and readily available for analysis and reporting.
Visualize data in various BI tools, ensuring that data products are easily accessible and user-friendly: Make data available to a variety of Business Intelligence tools, ensuring that end-users can access the data they need in a format that is intuitive and easy to understand. This may involve creating dashboards, reports, and visualizations tailored to different user needs.
Ensure data integrity and compliance with company data policies: Actively monitor and validate data to ensure accuracy and integrity. Ensure that all data processes and storage comply with company policies and any applicable data protection regulations.
Provide training and support to end-users on BI tools and data products: Offer training sessions and support to end-users, helping them understand how to use BI tools and access the data products available. Assist them in interpreting data and using it effectively in their roles.


What are the perks of working at Eventellect?

A fast-growing company that’s respected in Houston (Houston Business Journal’s Best Places to Work multiple years) and nationally (INC 5000 list of fastest-growing companies 10 years in a row)
A competitive salary plus bonus potential
A comprehensive benefits package, including 90% employee medical coverage, as well as dental and vision coverage, basic term life insurance and short-term disability coverage.
401K program including company match
Unlimited paid vacation policy
A $1,000 annual ticket budget to spend on sports and other live events around the country.
Offsite company events

Create solutions which are flexible, user friendly and match the needs of our ever-growing knowledge-based company
Support the expansion of the North American Natural Gas business, new commodity strategies and the corresponding system and functional requirements

Experience in a business analyst, business systems analyst, or process analyst role
IT related experience in trading (commodities)
Direct experience working with business users to deliver solutions through the delivery lifecycle

What Will Put You Ahead



Experience with Natural Gas related systems and interacting with internal customers from Front office to Back office including familiarity with Front Office, Scheduling, Middle Office, Credit Risk, Settlements/Accounting and Market Risk processes of wholesale, asset management transactions
Experience supporting Openlink modules and use of solution design methodologies like design thinking, agile, design sprint and lean.
Understanding of Deal Modeling, PNL and Position reporting, PNL calculations for linear and non-linear deals, and working knowledge of Parametric VaR

Position is not eligible for sponsorship.

Position Summary



As a Junior IT Business Analyst, your primary purpose is to collaborate with and support seasoned business analysts in translating business needs into effective technology solutions. You will play a vital role in contributing to the documentation of requirements, participating in product design discovery, and assisting in the development of reliable and cost-effective solutions. This role is designed to provide you with a learning environment where you can grow alongside experienced professionals, gaining valuable insights into the intersection of technology and business analysis. This position will give you the opportunity to grow to become an active thought partner and solution visionary who shapes the technology demand and direction in the business organization.


LOCATION


Role provides the opportunity to work in hybrid environment, working both virtually and in office when required.
Duties & Responsibilities


Works with IT and the business to identify opportunities for systematic or process improvements to reduce process inefficiencies and improve service levels.
Supporting Requirements Gathering:
o Collaborate with and assist senior business analysts in gathering and documenting business needs and objectives.
o Participate in interviews, surveys, and workshops to collect information from end-users and subject matter experts.

Documentation Assistance:
o Work with senior analysts to translate business requirements into clear and concise documentation.
o Contribute to the creation of user stories, use cases, and process flows to effectively communicate requirements.

Collaborative Product Design:
o Support senior analysts in product design discovery sessions with Product Owners and users.
o Assist in translating business requirements into valuable offerings that align with project goals.

Solution Development Support:
o Work alongside the team to leverage existing, new, or emerging technologies for developing cost-effective solutions.
o Contribute to the design process, ensuring solutions meet business requirements and address challenges effectively.

Team Collaboration:
o Collaborate closely with existing business analysts, developers, testers, and project managers to ensure the successful delivery of solutions.
o Engage in effective communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Learning and Development:
o Actively seek opportunities to learn from experienced professionals.
o Demonstrate eagerness to enhance skills and understanding of business processes and technology concepts.

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Management Information Systems (MIS) or equivalent combination of education and experience.
0-2 years of experience with IT business support.

Proficiency in all Microsoft Office products offerings, including Visio.
Some basic knowledge of database design and development.


DESIRED


Masters in computer science, Management Information Systems (MIS).
Degree or diploma in Business Management.
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or PMI-BA certification.

IT internship experience.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER CHARACTERISTICS


Professional commitment to high quality, and a passion for learning new skills.

Strong problem-solving skills, including providing simple solutions to complex situations.

Job Title: Programmer Analyst II - Center for Health Care Data
Job Description:
What we do here changes the world. UTHealth Houston is Texas’ resource for healthcare education, innovation, scientific discovery, and excellence in patient care. That’s where you come in.

We are looking for a Full-Time Programmer Analyst to join the Center for Health Care Data as part of the UTHealth School of Public Health in Houston, TX. In this position, you will be responsible for analyzing datasets, developing program specifications, writing and maintaining programs, coding and testing programs, and providing production support. This position encourages creative thinking and depends on working productively with many team members, including public health researchers and advocates, clinicians, statisticians, IT system experts, project managers, policy experts, etc.

Once you join us you won't want to leave. It’s because we reward our team for the excellent service they provide. Our total rewards package includes the benefits you’d expect from a top healthcare organization (benefits, insurance, etc.), plus:

100% paid medical premiums for our full-time employees
Generous time off (holidays, preventative leave day, both vacation and sick time – all of which equates to around 37-38 days per year)
The longer you stay, the more vacation you’ll accrue!
Longevity Pay (Monthly payments after two years of service)
Build your future with our awesome retirement/pension plan!

We take care of our employees! As a world-renowned institution, our employees’ wellbeing is important to us. We offer work/life services such as...

Free financial and legal counseling
Free mental health counseling services
Gym membership discounts and access to wellness programs
Other employee discounts including entertainment, car rentals, cell phones, etc.
Resources for child and elder care
Plus many more!

Position Summary:

The Center for Health Care Data (CHCD) has a series of projects related to service contracts, outcomes research, and research on population health and health outcomes. The Programmer Analyst II works with senior staff to create the coding required to extract data to support researcher questions. Responsible for analyzing datasets, developing program specifications, writing and maintaining programs, and coding and testing programs. This position encourages creative thinking and depends on the ability to work productively with a wide range of team members including data scientists, experienced programmers, biostatisticians, project managers, etc.




Position Key Accountabilities:

Consult with and analyze the users’ needs to ensure the programming and resulting data extract fulfill the required needs.
Analyzes/designs system flows and develops/codes program specifications to ensure the agreed-upon requirements are met.
Writes, tests, and implements computer programs. Codes straight-forward to moderately complex programs and ensure that the programs conform to departmental standards
Tests programming thoroughly to ensure all expected results are verified and discrepancies are resolved.
Adheres to departmental standards to ensure the consistency of product produced.
Participates in structured technical and functional walk-throughs with project team members and reports the status of programming to team members/clients on a regular basis to ensure a full understanding of the program and the status of completion.
Resolves problems that arise with existing data systems to ensure the efficiency and proper functioning of programs and systems.
Other duties as assigned

Certification/Skills:

Knowledge of computer hardware, software, and programming.

Preferred:

Experience with SQL, statistical analysis programs such as SAS, R, or STATA
Any programming language PL/SQL, python is a plus
Knowledge of administrative healthcare claims, electronic medical records, and social determinants of health datasets is a plus.

Minimum Education:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field or relevant experience in lieu of education.

Minimum Experience:

Two years of programming experience.

Physical Requirements:

Exerts up to 50 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 20 pounds frequently and/or up to 10 pounds constantly to move objects.

Security Sensitive:

This job class may contain positions that are security sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of Texas Education Code § 51.215

Residency Requirement:

Employees must permanently reside and work in the State of Texas.

SUMMARY:

The Data & Performance Analyst will play a crucial role in our workforce development efforts by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data related to our programs and services. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with a strong analytical mindset and the ability to turn data into actionable insights. The Data & Performance Analyst will contribute to our organization's success by ensuring data accuracy, monitoring program performance, and helping drive informed decision-making.

Responsibilities:

1. Adheres to the mission of SERCO.

2. Data Collection: Collect and maintain accurate and comprehensive data related to workforce development programs, including participant demographics, employment outcomes, and training metrics.

2. Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess program effectiveness and impact.

3. Reporting: Prepare regular reports and dashboards to communicate program performance to internal stakeholders, funders, and partners.

4. Performance Metrics: Develop and maintain a set of performance metrics and benchmarks to evaluate the success of workforce development initiatives.

5. Data Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through data cleaning, validation, and documentation processes.

6. Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with program managers to identify areas for improvement and provide data-driven recommendations to enhance program outcomes.

7. Research and Benchmarking: Stay current with industry best practices, research, and trends in workforce development to inform program enhancements.


8. Compliance: Ensure that data collection and reporting activities comply with all relevant regulations and reporting requirements.

9. Performs other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in data analytics, statistics, business, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the context of workforce development or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as Microsoft Excel, SQL, R, Python, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with workforce development programs and industry trends is a plus.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI is a plus.

DESIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Excellent oral and written communications skills (Bi-lingual preferred, English/Spanish).
Excellent writing and presentation skills.
Knowledge of business practices, administrative procedures and personnel development.
Knowledge of E-commerce principles and applied technology.
Knowledge of relevant federal, state, and local regulations affecting workforce center operations.
Knowledge of computer software and data systems.
Knowledge of community employers, stakeholders, demographics, and resources.


Must have Physical demands and work environment:

The physical demands and work environment characteristics describe here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS: While performing duties of the job, employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; for long periods of time. Employee must be able to drive for extended periods of time. Employees must occasionally lift and /or move up to 25 pounds, must be able to set up display area.
WORK ENVIRONMENT: Fast paced, demanding physically and mentally, will be in constant communications.


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

[Houston]


The following posting is a pipeline requisition, meant to accumulate candidates for 2024. Qualified applicants will be contacted in concert with the approval and publication of identical, approved positions within HP, Inc.

About Us

Innovation is in HP’s DNA. From our origins in a Palo Alto garage in 1939, to our current position as one of the world’s leading technology companies, HP has grown to become a leader in technology and corporate culture, inspiring innovators, and entrepreneurs around the globe.


HP brings together a portfolio that spans printing, personal computing, software, and services to serve more than 1 billion customers in over 170 countries. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace that attracts exceptional talent and to supporting our employees to succeed at all levels. We dream in over 35 languages and share one mission: to engineer experiences that amaze.


The Program:

Our future success depends on the innovation and fresh ideas you bring to HP, Inc. We are hiring students and new graduates with a diverse set of skills and experiences to join us, across the different organizations that make us HP, Inc. Our new grad program is intended to help you learn and grow at HP, give you an opportunity to make an impact, and work with leading edge technology. At HP, you’ll use advanced tools and technology to tackle complex challenges that make a real impact on people’s lives.


The Team:

Finance is committed to helping build a Future Ready HP by delivering business results, driving transformation, and developing our people. Finance is a strategic partner to the business and plays an integrated role by providing insights that guide business decisions and support HP’s corporate goals.


In addition to traditional operations such as accounting, reporting, tax, audit and treasury, HP Finance leverages technology and data analytics to gather, analyze, and interpret financial and operational data. This data-driven approach allows for more accurate forecasting, risk assessment, and performance measurement, leading to better decision-making across the organization, positioning HP for long-term success and helping to accelerate growth.


Responsibilities:

As a Financial Analyst, you will work with a team to:


Provide financial analysis for a function or business.

Perform data extraction and analyzes data to make recommendations.

Handle financial business issues.

Provide analytics to business initiatives.

Develop an understanding of HP's financial processes and a working knowledge of the business.


Education and Experience Required (Objective Minimum Qualifications)


Have no more than 12 months of prior work experience professionally related to the Graduate Hire Requisition they are applying to, (not including internships, teaching assistance, research work, or military experience).

Will have completed at least your bachelor’s degree prior to your anticipated start date with HP.

Able to obtain work authorization in the United States without requiring sponsorship in the future.


Preferred Knowledge and Skills (Preferred Qualifications):

Preferred majors include (but are not limited to) Finance, Accounting, and Economics.

Basic understanding of accounting processes.

Basic analytical skills.

Good business application skills (e.g., Microsoft Office suite).

Good communication skills.

Good teamwork skills.

Good critical thinking and problem-solving skills.


We are looking for visionaries who are ready to make an impact on the way the world works. At HP, the future is yours to create. Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to your knowledge and interests please apply today— we are eager to learn more about you.

Business Analyst I - Process Automation - (Requisition ID: 230000EW)

Description


Company Overview

Nabors is a leading provider of advanced technology for the energy industry. With operations in about 20 countries, Nabors has established a global network of people, technology and equipment to deploy solutions that deliver safe, efficient and responsible hydrocarbon production. By leveraging its core competencies, particularly in drilling, engineering, automation, data science and manufacturing, Nabors aims to innovate the future of energy and enable the transition to a lower carbon world.

Nabors is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibiting discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, religion, age, color, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. To learn more about our Fair Employment practices, please refer to the Nabors Code of Conduct.




JOB SUMMARY

The primary responsibilities of the Process Automation entry level Business Analyst to support the strategy and design of the process automation business solution. Identify potential processes that are good for automation. Assist with the creation of process design documents, testing, troubleshooting and reporting. This role will interface directly with the business and act as liaison between process owners, the technical automation team, and the center of excellence (COE).

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Identify and prioritize key areas of the business where robotic solutions and automations can drive significant business benefit
Helps identify automation candidates and develop associated business cases for opportunities for improvement in existing processes
Collaborate with process owners to understand the end-to-end process
Assist with the creation of process design documents, testing, troubleshooting and reporting
Define complexity of the process in terms of Robotic Process Automation to alter or reengineer the process to automate or improve automation potential
Analyze and observe processes to understand the steps and applications used to complete business transactions
Develop Process Design Documents (PDDs) to inform development of automations by technical teams
Partner with process owners and the center of excellence (COE) throughout the course of process identification, planning, and implementation of automations, and serve as a liaison with the technical team and business team/process owner to develop engagement deliverables, such as PDD, test plan, test cases, and test automations
Serve as integrators between business needs and technology solutions, helping to create technology-enabled solutions to meet business needs
Collaborate with leaders to understand and bring to bear innovative digital technologies (RPA, AI, etc.) to transform business processes.
Identify automation industry best practices and recommend opportunities to improve work procedures

Qualifications


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience
Ability to learn information quickly and apply risk/control considerations which impact downstream decisions.
Critical thinking skills with strong attention to detail and follow up.
High degree of professionalism and personal integrity
Excellent interpersonal, communications, presentation skills and organizational skills
Effective project management skills (task identification, prioritization, and documentation)



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Should have a good blend of Technology and Process knowledge



BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES

Accountability – Level Two
Excellence – Level Two
Innovation – Level Two
Safety – Level Two
Teamwork & Collaboration – Level Two
Communication – Level Two
Decision Making – Level Two
Leadership – Level Two
Business Focus – Level Two



TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

IT Environment - Level One
Technology Trends & Directions - Level One
IT Governance - Level Two
Data Collection and Analysis - Level Two
Project Management - Level Two

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and use hands. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance

Role: Responsible for analyzing large sets of data to identify patterns and trends that will help drive business decisions. This role will involve collaborating with various departments to provide insights that will enhance our credit union's operations, sales, marketing, and customer experience. The candidate should possess excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities:
Collect, process, and analyze large sets of data using statistical methods and software. Identify trends, patterns, and insights from data to support business decisions and enhance operations, sales, marketing, and customer experience.
Collaborate with department heads to develop dashboards, reports, and presentations that effectively communicate data insights.
Develop and maintain data models and databases to facilitate data analysis and reporting. Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and integrity through data cleansing, validation, and verification.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation to enhance data analysis efficiency and accuracy.
Performance Measurements:
ACCURACY OF DATA ANALYSIS: The accuracy of the data analysis is crucial for making informed business decisions. Performance is measured by the accuracy of analysis, which can be determined by comparing findings to actual outcomes.
TIMELINESS OF REPORTS: Provide timely reports to stakeholders. Reports should be delivered on time and within the expected time frame.
IMPROVEMENT IN KPIs: Analysis should result in measurable improvements in the credit union's key performance indicators (KPIs), such as loan growth, member retention, or cost reduction. Performance is measured based on the improvement in these KPIs.
QUALITY OF INSIGHTS: Provide actionable insights that can help stakeholders make informed business decisions. The quality of these insights is evaluated based on their relevance, validity, and impact on the business.
COLLABORATION: Work collaboratively with various stakeholders across different departments. Performance is evaluated on ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with stakeholders to understand their needs and provide relevant insights.
AUTOMATION OF PROCESSES: Automate data analysis processes to improve efficiency and accuracy. Performance is measured based on the number of processes automated and the resulting time and cost savings.

Knowledge and Skills:
Experience -Three years to five years of similar or related experience.
Education - (1) A bachelor's degree, or (2) achievement of formal certifications recognized in the industry as equivalent to a bachelor's degree (e.g., information technology certifications in lieu of a degree).
Interpersonal Skills - Willing to learn new skills as required for accomplishing responsibilities. Strong verbal and written communication skills, with attention to details. Work involves much personal contact with others inside and/or outside the organization for the purpose of first-level conflict resolution, building relationships, and soliciting cooperation. Discussions involve a higher degree of confidentiality and discretion, requiring diplomacy and tact in communication.
Other Skills - Must have expert computer skills in working with office applications such as word processing and spreadsheet applications. Background in data modeling and business process analysis. Report writing proficiency using SQL, SSRS and Jaspersoft Report Studio. Advanced data analysis using business intelligence software, preferably PowerBI. The ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks across multiple projects concurrently. Strong analytical problem-solving, analysis, communication and documentation skills.

EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator Job Description

At Air Products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. Grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse, and most profitable industrial gas company in the world.

Reimagine What’s Possible

EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator Roles and Responsibilities:

We are seeking a EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator within our GEMTE team located at our Houston. This position requires _30__% domestic / global travel.

The Data Analyst & Incident Investigator is responsible for establishing databases that provide an opportunity to track all EH&S incident data from the Project’s in the Americas. Additionally, the incumbent will be responsible for supporting Incident investigations of Recordable and HPFA Events. Although primarily an office-based role, the incumbent will be required to spend time on Site to support investigations throughout the Americas.
Job Description
Collect and manage EHS data from various sources including incident reports, safety inspections, and compliance audits. Analyze EHS data to identify trends, patterns, and areas of concern. Support the development and implementation of safety campaigns. Collate incident reports for the SIRB monthly / Quarterly reviews. Participate in RCA’s when requested. Generate regular reports (Monthly, Quarterly / Annual) on EHS performance, including incident rates, compliance levels, and progress towards EHS goals. Work closely with Americas EHS staff to ensure accurate data collection and reporting. Utilize data analysis tools and software to effectively manage and analyze EHS data. Assist in the development of EHS policies and procedures based on data analysis. Support EHS audits and inspections by providing necessary data and analysis. Train other staff on data collection and reporting procedures as necessary. Stay current on local, national, and international EHS regulations to ensure accurate reporting. Participate in EHS meetings and present data analysis findings. Be familiar with all BSP tools. Performs incident investigations using cross-functional teams to interview witnesses, review procedures/regulations, gather timelines, and observe the scene. Then, determine causal factors and recommend corrective/preventative actions. Supporting the preparation of incident investigation reports and action plans.

Required Skills / Abilities:

Bachelor’s Degree in EH&S or related science/engineering area.
Good English skills (reading, writing, & speaking).
Proven experience in data analysis and reporting.
Knowledge of EHS regulations and standards.
Proficiency in data analysis software and tools such as SAP-EM, Qliksense, MS-Forms and Excel.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy.
Ability to work in a team and collaborate with different stakeholders.
Y-TREE, ICAM, SOLOGIC or TapRoot Training.
Working knowledge of best professional EH&S practices in conducting accident investigations, compliance audits and project health surveys.
Proficiency in assisting construction with development of risk assessments and associated job hazard analysis.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a project team.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to explain, explore and discuss safety issues with range of stakeholders.
Skilled in working collaboratively with others in a complex integrated environment.
