JOB SUMMARY:
The Incident Management Analyst (more daily event management) has a major role in managing ITSM processes based on ITIL best practices. Successful candidates will be focused on core IT Service Management/ITIL functions but not limited to areas such as Incident Management, Service Level Management, etc. The Incident Management Analyst will ensure that standardized methods and procedures (ITIL v4) are used for efficient and prompt handling of all incidents in order to minimize the impact of incidents on service quality and delivery. The Incident Management Analyst will be instrumental in identifying opportunities to improve day-to-day operations of the organization.

Proactive review of the environment – review for trends/work with service owners/bigger issue that warrants the creation of a ticket.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determines, analyzes and formulates current practices, user needs and workflow processes, issues and potential solutions.

Obtains relevant data/information.

Analyzes, aggregates, assimilates, and validates data/information.

Coordinates resources assigned to complete projects. Includes managing and coordinating data, information and/or personnel.

Analyzes project impacts and dependencies across the IS organization.

Recommends process changes as determined from risk and failure points in the processes evaluated, with necessary modifications to workflows and/or current procedures to maximize the advantages of existing systems.

Analysis of current business practices, user needs and workflow processes.

Develop training programs and materials/documentation for all user types.

In the event of an outage, incident or emergency, ensures all Incident Management processes are adhered to. Making sure tickets are being generated/ parent/child tied correctly/ documentation accurate PREFERRED – experience with SNOW major incident module

Incident investigation and diagnosis.

Detection of possible problems and the assignment to the Problem Management team.
Participation in audit activities related to the Incident Management process.
Responsible for Incident Management reporting.
Collaborates with IS Leadership and IS Executive teams in driving service management best practice and ITIL process standardization.
Ability to create and deliver Executive Level reports based on ticket analysis. Pulling dashboard from SNOW to share with leaders
Identify areas of opportunities and recommend improvements in the execution of the process.
Continuous development and daily management of Service Quality.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Experience with SNOW dashboard – weekly aging report, working within SNOW to review tickets, looking at tickets that are nt being updated. Looking at incidents that are being re-assigned multiple times. Dig into the WHY. Opportunity to improve KA?
Monitor tickets for incorrect priority – just “watch the queue” real time
Ability to look at “what drove the tickets”
Knows difference between INCIDENT and SERVICE REQUESTS
Well rounded experience with incident management and how it all FITS TOGETHER
Participate in testing of new SNOW modules/upgrades
Take the data and TELL A STORY… what does it all mean?

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Excellent communicator with strong facilitation and soft skills.
Strong social, interpersonal skills, customer-centric attitude and ability to deal with highly complex and high pressured situations.
Analytical skills. Must possess the ability to understand business processes and workflows.
Ability to liaise with executive-level sponsors.
Ability to work well under pressure.
Flexible and adapts to rapid change.
Working knowledge of ServiceNow and other ticket systems.
Ability to logically analyze problems and develop efficient and effective solutions.
Ability to compile and analyze data, identify patterns, trends and problems, make recommendations for improvement, and prepare reports for management review.
Ability to plan, assign, and direct the work of others.
Ability to perform work requiring close attention to detail.
Ability to establish and maintain satisfactory relationships with other departments, employees, and the general public using courtesy, patience, and tact.
Verbal and written communication skills, planning, analytical and problem solving skills.
Good customer service skills required and ability to work well in a team environment.

Who we are
Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

The Escrow Analyst I Specialist will be responsible for reviewing and completing escrow analysis in accordance with RESPA (Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act) for all escrow loans and non-escrow loans with negative escrow advances. Perform all duties in accordance with the company guidelines, applicable federal, state, and local regulations.

Responsibilities:
Perform daily Ad-Hoc escrow analysis for the portfolio – including the review of escrow line detail, and preliminary shortage and overage reports to clear all exceptions for a final analysis that is compliant with RESPA Regulations.
Solves problems rapidly and cost-effectively with minimal disruption.
Perform monthly bulk escrow analysis for the portfolio following the Mass State Schedule
Research illogical collection amounts, due dates, or large changes in payment
Document findings by adding notes to the loan
Complete the steps to process the escrow analysis and create a change in monthly payment
Process requests received from the mortgage holder, clients, or other departments
Monitor work volumes and adjust work types or production to meet department needs
Maintain consistent attendance to ensure fulfillment of essential duties and responsibilities.
Qualifications/Skills:
Minimum of 1+ years residential mortgage loan servicing experience.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Outlook).
Detail oriented with excellent organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Possess excellent communication (written and verbal) and customer service skills.
Ability to effectively and accurately communicate with all levels within the organization.
Proven ability to work well both independently and as a team member.
Ability to make sound decisions based upon department, company policies, procedures, knowledge and experience.
Onbase imaging system experience a plus.
Knowledge of SQL (Preferred but not required).
Flexible to changing priorities, project scopes, and deadlines.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, not required or equivalent mortgage experience

Description:


Callon Petroleum Company (NYSE: CPE) is an independent oil and natural gas company focused on the acquisition, exploration and development of high-quality assets in the leading oil plays of West Texas (Permian Basin).

Our people are passionate and innovative and shape our understanding of what is possible and challenge us to consider new ideas. If you are looking for a rewarding career in a highly-collaborative, fast-paced, fully empowered environment, Callon is where you belong!

Position Description

The System Analyst – Data Analytics will work as a primary interface between business units and the Data Analytics team. The Data Analytics team is focused on utilizing technology to improve processes, help employees be more effective, and improve the use of data across the organization to drive business insights. The System Analyst will analyze complex business needs presented by the user community and recommend and implement technical solutions by working with Sr Systems Analysts, System Analysts and/or outside contractors as directed by the Director of Data.

Responsibilities

Management and support of production systems, patching, upgrades, outages, and deployments of automation tools, including UiPath, master data management tools, and data analytics tools.
Providing first level UiPath support, researching application/data issues, identifying deficiencies and/or data integrity issues and proposing remediation solutions for all key applications utilized by the Data Analytics team.
Facilitating meetings with business users, gather detailed requirements in a high quality, clear and concise documentation as an Agile Story, generate process workflow diagrams and provide updates to management and key stakeholders.
Execute using implementation controls and prepare SOX documentation where applicable.
Training - Providing end user training on supported systems. Developing training materials under the guidance of senior team members and management.
Data & Reports - Creating reports and data extracts as needed by business. Identifying opportunities for optimization of data integration processes between all supported software.
Project Management - Generating project plans as needed on small to medium sized projects. Conducting meetings, tracking status and milestones, and providing management with summarized and actionable updates.
Implementing solutions, performing analysis and other duties as assigned relating to any system the Data Analytics team supports or as directed by supervisor.
Communicating status to management proactively.
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements:


Bachelor Degree in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
3+ years of progressive experience as a Developer, Programmer, Technical Analyst or Backend Analyst.
High level expertise in automation tools, including UiPath Automation Suite, SharePoint forms and workflows, Microsoft Power Platform, and other similar tools.
Experience with Spotfire, PowerBI.
Experience with SSRS a plus.
In addition to being systems focused, this is also a user facing role, must be personable, a strong communicator, and be able to manage user requests and issues in a calm, friendly and effective manner.
Ownership of systems and persistence in resolving issues is crucial.
Self-motivated, detail oriented and organized, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Strong work ethic and personal integrity.
Ability to provide after-hours support and be on call as needed from time to time.
Ability to lead projects with limited supervision.
Technical knowledge and ability to easily converse with developers.
Prior experience working with Oil and Gas companies is a plus (including knowledge of Oil & Gas software such as Enertia, Quorum, Waterfield, Bolo, WellView, Aries, ProCount, etc.).

Benefits of joining Callon

We at Callon Petroleum are proud to have been recognized as a top workplace by the Houston Chronicle five out of the last six years including in 2022. Because we hire the best people, we work hard to provide a total rewards program that focuses on our employees' goals and needs. We offer competitive, performance-based compensation packages and a best-in-class benefit program.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

ConocoPhillips is a leading oil and gas company, based in Houston, TX, and is hiring IT Business Analysts for contract positions. We are looking for an experienced Information Technology Business Analyst with a strong understanding of upstream oil and gas operations and production optimization. Initial focus will be in the area of production engineering and optimization but will expand later to other aspects of daily upstream oil and gas field operations. Candidate will assist in the development of requirements, workflow analysis and development, research of technology solutions in the industry, and navigate administrative processes within the Information Technology organization. Candidate will also be asked to perform limited scrum master duties for a technical delivery team.

Key Accountabilities

Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, document, and validate business requirements related to upstream oil and gas business workflows and processes.
Process Analysis: Analyze existing business processes and identify areas where technology can be leveraged to streamline operations, improve decision-making, and enhance productivity.
Solution Design: Work with technical teams and architects to translate business requirements into IT solutions, including software applications, data analytics, and system integrations.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret data related to oil and gas operations, providing insights to support business decisions and optimize processes.
Vendor Management: Identify, research, and evaluate external vendors and solutions they offer within the targeted business workflows.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and project status reports.
Scrum Master: Serve as a limited scrum master for a shared technical delivery team.

Required and Preferred Skills and Experience

Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the upstream oil and gas operations and production sector.
Strong understanding of oil and gas operations and industry-specific challenges.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with various stakeholders in both business and IT functions.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools.
Familiarity with industry-specific software and technologies.

David Weekley Homes is looking for an energetic candidate capable of working with a team of Business Analysts that perform training and implementation on multiple business systems. Do you strive to contribute to the success of others as well as the projects assigned to their team? Do you enjoy learning and then sharing that information with others?

The Candidate
We are looking for:
A good fit with a collaborative team. Someone the team can trust.
A natural leader that others want to follow.
A hard worker. You see tasks through to the end without supervision and ask for more. You know when to ask for help and you give bad news early.
On any given day, you may be leading a training class, researching a business process, creating a potential solution to address a business challenge or testing a program change with developers or Team Members.
You can create a productive, interactive and welcoming training environment balancing class/user inquiries and engagement with meeting training objectives within the given time frame
You understand action planning, accountability, cost/benefit analysis, communication plans, process models with facilitation and training in multiple learning styles.
An effective communicator. You believe in listening to learn more than you talk. You can effectively communicate by email, phone, webinar or formal presentations for everyone from the front line to the top executives.
The Position
You will be required to:
Assist the Business Systems Training Leader to develop effective training methods for existing and new business systems and processes.
Participate in and lead training regularly throughout the year in a small class environment and as needed with individuals.
Dig into the business processes and understand what we do and why we do it – then be willing to share everything you just learned!
Facilitate and participate in business system development and updates – help determine critical business requirements and work with development team to translate these into simple, smart system solutions.
Communicate project updates to Team Members at all levels of the company. Answer questions and solicit feedback.
Document business processes in a way that can be easily understood by Team Members.
Have enough technical expertise to talk with a developer and yet be able to explain a technical issue to an end-user without sounding like you are speaking a foreign language.
Develop ad hoc reports from system databases to support business process owners.
Motivate the Teams you are working with to meet mutually agreed upon but aggressive deadlines.
Travel! This position can involve 60-80% travel at any given time depending on the current projects in progress.
The Technical
You need to have or know:
Prior experience training end users on business systems, preferably both one on one and in a classroom setting. You’re able to convey information clearly to users with limited technical knowledge and adapt your vocabulary and teaching style to your audience.
Excellent communication and presentation skills – everyone looks forward to seeing the creative and fun ways you can lead a group discussion or present a new topic (or even an old topic that is being revisited for the tenth time…)
A background or education in process improvement.
An ability to solve complex problems, communicate clearly, and share a sense of urgency.
The capacity to thrive in a small, flexible and dynamic environment, contributing to a high performance, low-stress corporate culture.
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt is preferred
Work Location

This position is not 100% remote – you will be expected to work in the office a minimum of 3 days per week. Our office is located in West Houston, near the intersection I-10 Katy Freeway and 610 W Loop N Frwy.

The Company

David Weekley Homes is an award-winning home builder that has earned spots on FORTUNE® magazine's list of “100 Best Companies to Work For” 17 times! We build in 19 markets coast to coast and are the largest privately-held builder in America. We have an excellent benefits package, with some unique features including:

Great opportunities to participate in outreach and community involvement programs

401(k) with discretionary 8% match
Profit Sharing
Team Member & Family New Home Discount
Team Member Product Discounts
College Scholarship Program
And More!!

Geologic Data Analyst will support the planning and execution of the drilling and development program. This Data Analyst role requires detailed management of Realtime and end-of-well data from engineering and geologic sources; an ability to evaluate and QC that data; and skills to support bigger picture projects using Spotfire, Petrel, and Starsteer software. Most tasks will require a proficiency in programming languages such as Python and VBA. We are seeking an analyst with an understanding of Geology, Geo steering, and Drilling basics. Responsibilities: • Sorting, QC’ing, and/or archiving of well plans, well headers, well location reconciliation, EOW Reports, mudlogs, and final well curve data • QCing and updating the GeoNet database with daily incoming data, geo model extractions, core data, and regular final report notes. • QCing and updating our Trouble Time databases and integrating with drilling data • Creating and maintaining Starsteer base projects, and organizing older Starsteer final projects • Updating our Starsteer projects with core data, wireline curves, and two-component curves • Managing real-time WITSML feeds • Creating and maintaining Spotfire dashboards • Python scripting support and troubleshooting for macros and tools Required: • Bachelor's degree or higher in Geospatial-related fields or Data Architecture, Engineering, or Management fields • 2+ years of industry experience in geoscience and/or data analytics • Advanced Python, SQL, API’s, and VBA programming proficiency • Proficient with MS Office suite of tools, Spotfire, and Arc GIS • Strong written and verbal communication skills

ConocoPhillips is a leading oil and gas company, based in Houston, TX, and is hiring IT Business Analysts for contract positions. The IT Sr. Business Analyst position sits within the IT HSE & SD Capability team. This team provides both business functional and technical application support for HSE & SD applications and systems across the ConocoPhillips global business units. This role is accountable for understanding and translating business strategies, processes, workflows, and systems into applicable functional/technical requirements. This role collaborates closely with key business leaders, stakeholders, technical teams, and vendors to ensure all stakeholders’ needs are being met. The successful candidate is self-motivated, with a strong customer focus and excellent communications skills. The candidate should also have a working IT knowledge of best practices to deliver and guide the demands of both vended and in-house developed operational solutions throughout all phases of a software/solution development project.

Technology wise - Intelex experience/exposure (this is our primary application that is used corporate wide by 15,000 users)

Soft skills - strong communication, ability to manage multiple projects

MUST HAVE 1 YEAR EXPERIENCE WITH INTELEX

Key Accountabilities

Building and maintaining close relationships with the HSE & SD stakeholders and IT peers globally
Collaborating with business leaders and stakeholders in scoping, designing, and delivering business driven requests including facilitating discussions, capturing business requirements, translating requirements, framing the business case, understanding value drivers, solution review/comparison, solution recommendation/selection, and leading/managing solution implementation
Translating business needs/strategies into solution designs and deliverables including creation of features and user stories
Ensuring completion of IT Security Reviews as necessary coordinating with the business and applicable vendor for supporting documentation (e.g., Risk Assessment, GIPA exceptions, cloud evaluation, etc.)
Coordinate testing of system defects and enhancements including the development of test scripts and release notes, participating in testing, relaying defects to the vendor, and seeking business alignment for change requests and production go live
Leading efforts and serving as a Release Train Engineer & Scrum Master for the capability team
Developing a deep understanding of business acumen, end-to-end processes, workflows, systems, and data
Analyzing, prioritizing, troubleshooting, and resolving application and data issues
Researching 3rd party vended solutions and conducting research and analysis based on demands
Leading migration of internally hosted applications and processes to cloud-based SaaS/PaaS solutions
Leading data handover efforts for the capability due to acquisition and divestiture activities per contract requirements
Collaborating with the business leaders, stakeholders, and IT to develop and maintain our capability, application, and digital strategy roadmaps by staying aware of industry trends, vendor roadmaps and current and future business requirements
Development of supporting software documentation for IT and business reference (e.g., Knowledge Articles, ServiceNow records, application provisioning and audit instructions, etc.)
Leading vendor relationships and coordinating with vendors on contract renewals, delivery of fixes, enhancement requests, upgrades, and new system implementations
Identify opportunities to streamline, standardize and enhance our current processes and data management
Customer relationship management and communicating with the business customers around IT services, costs, and needs
Maintaining an attitude of diversity and inclusion to ensure that all perspectives are considered in the execution of work

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business Admin/Mgmt., Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, other related technical discipline, or foreign equivalent
3+ years of experience using Business Analysis methodologies (identifying and capturing business requirements, framing the business case, solution selection, managing solution implementation)
1+ years of experience leading large scale projects
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft O365 applications: Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, and Teams
Willing and able (with or without reasonable accommodation) to travel 10% of the time on a yearly basis

Preferred Skills and Experience

3+ years of experience in the Oil & Gas Industry
3+ years of experience implementing vended software applications
1+ years of experience with HSE & SD applications including: Intelex, Cority, Sphera, TapRoot, MIR3, and IAP.
1+ years of experience implementing solutions on cloud SaaS and PaaS; basic knowledge of MS Azure or AWS
Intermediate proficiency with Agile/SCRUM principles, tools (JIRA, ADO), estimation and planning
1+ years of Project Management experience with proven ability to balance priorities, facilitate multiple efforts at the same time and deliver results through realistic planning
Demonstrated ability to do business process mapping
Demonstrated ability to work independently, plan and carry out responsibilities with minimal direction and deliver results through realistic planning to accomplish goals
Takes ownership of actions and follows through on commitments by courageously dealing with important problems and holding others accountable
Influences business decisions which lead to delivery of value-add solutions that are in alignment with business capability requirements and IT standards.
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities to ensure deliverables are met on time
Builds positive relationships based on trust and seeks collaboration across organizational boundaries to achieve goals
Works collaboratively across organizations with capability teams and external stakeholders to ensure solution dependencies are identified and communicated

OVERVIEW
The Houston Public Works Department (HPW) is the largest and most diverse public works organization in the country. Accredited by the American Public Works Association, our over 4,000 dedicated public servants work together to create a strong foundation for Houston to thrive.

Within the HPW Department, the Houston Permitting Center Service Line (HPC) administers & enforces over 400 permit types for the City of Houston and its jurisdictions, annually reviews over 70 thousand commercial & residential plans. All members of the Houston Permitting Center team are service providers, and we work with the shared values of respect, ownership, communication, integrity, and teamwork.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Staff Analyst - Business Analyst

Functions in an analyst role reporting to the Senior Staff Analyst will provide analytical, administrative and/or management systems services.

The position will serve as a business process analyst representing the permitting organization in support of HouPermits, the permitting system that is currently in development. This business analyst will support system implementation, and work in a support role translating business needs into system requirements.

Responsibilities aligned with our Five to Thrive:

Respect – we listen and care

Ownership – we find solutions instead of excuses
Assists with tracking business requirements against the system development to ensure the requirements are considered and any gaps in system functionality are understood and accommodated.
Assists with testing and provides feedback, including recommendations for improvement to either system configuration or business processes.
Participates in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements.
Investigates and makes recommendations for addressing issues of medium to high complexity and/or sensitivity.
Completes special projects as assigned, working on a wide variety of financial, administrative, professional, management and community issues and problems of medium to high complexity.
Makes recommendations for process improvements.
Communication – we are reliable and clear
Assists in translating business requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, and user acceptance testing.

As a Marketing Data Analyst, you'll report directly to the Chief Data Officer. you will be responsible for leveraging your technical expertise and analytical skills to optimize digital marketing strategies and drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention for our direct-to-consumer channels. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing complex data sets, implementing advanced tracking methodologies, and leveraging cutting-edge digital tools to improve our brand's online presence, maximize return on investment (ROI), and enhance the overall customer experience.

What You'll Be Doing Everyday…

Data Analysis and Insights:

Conduct in-depth analysis of digital marketing campaigns using tools such as Google Analytics, Looker, Tableau and BigQuery, providing actionable insights to optimize marketing efforts.
Design, plan and execute experiments, including A/B tests, match-market tests and incrementality tests.
Analyze promotional campaigns, product launches and seasonal events.
Utilize statistical modeling techniques, such as regression analysis and cohort analysis, to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for campaign optimization.

Marketing Optimization:

Collaborate with the marketing team to strategize, execute, and optimize performance marketing campaigns across platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and other relevant channels.
Running incrementality tests and developing our attribution model to appropriately determine where to spend our next dollar
Running hold out market tests to evaluate impact of awareness/upperfunnel campaigns
Partner with the marketing team to define core metrics from which to understand marketing success and drive daily actions.
Collaborate with the CRM team to develop data-driven email marketing campaigns, leveraging behavioral triggers and segmentation strategies to optimize customer communication.
Implement advanced customer journey analysis, funnel analysis, and predictive modeling techniques to identify opportunities for improving customer experiences and maximizing customer lifetime value.

Reporting, Visualization, and Automation:

Develop and maintain automated reporting processes using data visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker, to deliver regular reports and dashboards on key digital marketing metrics and KPIs.
Provide advanced data visualizations and storytelling techniques to effectively communicate complex insights to stakeholders.
Identify opportunities to automate data collection, reporting, and analysis processes, leveraging APIs, scripts, and automation tools.

What You'll Need…

Bachelor's degree in marketing, computer science, statistics, or a related field (preferred not required).
3+ years experience as a digital marketing analyst or similar role, with a strong technical focus, preferably within the D2C industry.
Experience with attribution models, incrementality testing, metrics development, and hold out market tests.
Expertise in using tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, Looker, and BigQuery..
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
In-depth knowledge of digital advertising platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Ads) , as well as Email / SMS tools (e.g. Klaviyo, Attentive) and customer data platforms
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.

Disability insurance

Core Analyst I

SUMMARY

Qualified applicants must perform laboratory testing with emphasis on Petrophysical Work, Rock Mechanics and/or Flow Studies. Must be familiar with and able to utilize Laboratory Instruments effectively. Qualified applicants must be able to interpret scientific data, perform mathematical and scientific computations, maintain laboratory notebooks, be comfortable in a laboratory environment, and check for accuracy. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic computer skills are required.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Recording operating data from laboratory equipment including flow pumps, pressure transducers and gauges, scales and balances, resistivity monitors, and basic laboratory glassware.
Working independently on projects while maintaining a team atmosphere with other technicians.
Communicating data and results with supervisors and clients in a clear manner.
Researches the formation, dissolution, and content of rock layers.

Other Responsibilities

Applicants may be required to perform administrative duties related to project management include software management, sample management and technical report writing. Field work is required to obtain material for testing. Overtime work and various shifts may be required in order to meet the needs of the business and of our customers.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

A bachelor’s degree in Geology or related science is preferred. Should have knowledge of materials, methods, and the appropriate tools to develop laboratory testing systems designed for simulating reservoir behaviors. Preferred a strong emphasis on logical and mechanical reasoning in a laboratory environment. Must be computer literate with working knowledge of MS Office.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, management and other employees of the organization. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical and scientific journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Ability to respond to inquiries or complaints from clients.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals, and calculate area, circumference and volume. Ability to compute rate, ration and percent and interpret various graphs used to analyze data. Ability to apply mathematical operations to such tasks as determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, correlation techniques, and sampling theory.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of geological data problems. Ability to deal with formulas, scientific equations, and graphs.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS

Valid driver’s license and a good driving record.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, and taste or smell.
The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to fumes, or airborne particles. The employee is frequently exposed to toxic or caustic chemicals. The employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to risk of radiation.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Position Title: BI Analyst II (P2)

Company Summary

Crown Castle is the nation’s largest provider of shared communications infrastructure: towers, small cells and fiber. It all works together to meet unprecedented demand—connecting people and communities and transforming the way we do business. Whenever you make a call, track a workout or stream music and videos, we’re the ones providing the communications infrastructure that makes it all possible. From 5G and the internet of things to drones, autonomous vehicles and AR/VR, we enable the technologies that help people stay safe, connected and ready for the future. Crown Castle is publicly traded on the S&P 500, and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the US, with an enterprise value of ~$70B.

We offer a total benefits package and professional growth development for teammates in any stage of their career. Along with caring for our teammates, we’re an active member in the communities where we live, work and do business. We have a responsibility to give back, which we do through our Connected by Good program. Giving back allows us to improve public spaces where people connect, promote public safety and advance access to education and technology.

Role

The BI Analyst will work collaboratively and support cross-functional team members, providing and maintaining a world class reporting environment and BI (Business Intelligence) solutions. These responsibilities and deliverables should lead to business insights and enhance operational and customer analytics, leading to increased revenue and greater efficiencies.

Responsibilities

Daily support of end-users’ ability to effectively and efficiently utilize the reporting platform
Help to design, build, deliver and maintain world-class reporting environment for all areas of the Towers Group using Power BI and other Crown reporting platforms
Support development of BI roadmap based on Towers Group goals and project prioritization
Collaborating with D&D to ensure data quality and integrity in data warehouse platforms for BI reporting
Develop understanding of the various business processes, datasets and BI deliverables,
Communicate and collaborate with users and Business Performance team to analyze information needs and functional requirements, deliver moderately complex solutions based on needs
Collaborate with developers and domain experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs, support moderately complex solutioning
Adhere to sound data-governance and forward-looking data visualization
Work with divisional teams to understand the processes used to generate reports currently, supporting IT to automate these processes
Partner closely with technical and business teams to complete requirements gathering, testing and successful delivery

Expectations

Collaborative and data driven with strong analytical and technical skills

Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Skills / Requirements

JOB SUMMARY:

The Lead Quality Data Analyst collaborates with and provides consultation to Harris Health System Nursing Leadership and works closely with the Director of Nursing Quality to design and implement tools and processes to facilitate standard and accurate data collection, analysis, and reporting of data in accordance with professional and regulatory standards. This individual designs, builds, manages, and modifies systems and data bases at the system level. This individual coordinates data activities for Nursing across the system, including formatting and presenting data as usable information; tracking and trending information and creating and generating reports from various data sources. This individual provides oversight control over nursing data and is responsible for the data integrity and the data repositories. This individual also provides consultation to the Harris Health System Leadership related to audit activities, benchmarking, process evaluation, and outcomes development.

The Lead Quality Data Analyst upholds high standards of integrity, ethical behavior, mentors others, role models professionalism and participates in activities such as professional organizations, research and the community. Tableau experience is preferred.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

1. Education/Specialized Training/Licensure:

a. Masters Degree required;
b. Training in database design, process design, audit tool design;
c. Excel, Access, Scantron software, PowerPoint, SPSS, Risk Pro, Word, Share Point, Readiness Rounds, V-Survey, infoEDGE; and
d. Five plus (5+) years applicable experience.

2. Work Experience: Five plus (5+) years in related data analyst or quality role preferred in health care setting.

3. Equipment Operated: Computer, scanner, fax printers, copiers, etc.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

1. Communication Skills:
Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)
Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)
Writing /Composing (Correspondence / Reports)

2. Other Skills:
Analytical CRT
Design Medical Terms Mathematics
PC Research Statistical
Word Proc

3. Advanced Education:

Masters Degree

4. Work Schedule:
Flexible On Call Eligible For Telecommute

5. Other Requirements:
a. Advanced database experience in maintaining and troubleshooting;
b. Computer literacy at an advanced level;
c. Experience in analyzing and presenting data in documents, graphs and verbally; and
d. Advance customer service skills.

Job Summary:

WHO ARE WE?

Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment and eCommerce company, comprised of four market leaders: Ticketmaster.com, Live Nation Concerts, Front Line Management Group and Live Nation Network. Ticketmaster.com is the global event ticketing leader and one of the world’s top five eCommerce sites, with over 26 million monthly unique visitors. Live Nation Concerts produces over 20,000 shows annually for more than 2,000 artists globally. Front Line is the world’s top artist management company, representing over 250 artists. These businesses power Live Nation Network, the leading provider of entertainment marketing solutions, enabling over 800 advertisers to tap into the 200 million consumers Live Nation delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. For additional information, visit www.livenation.com/investors .

WHO ARE YOU?

Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!

THE R OLE :

The Analyst, Supplier Diversity & Inclusion will gather and maintain metrics and data to measure the impact of all aspects of Live Nation’s supplier diversity and inclusion initiatives. Reporting to the Program Manager of Supplier Diversity & Inclusion, this role requires a combination of data analysis, relationship building, and identifying opportunities to ensure Live Nation maintains an inclusive business environment and meets its diversity commitments. The Analyst will also have opportunities to directly support the Head of Global Procurement with a variety of ongoing and ad hoc initiatives that span the full breadth of services provided by the Global Procurement team.


WHAT THIS ROLE WILL DO :

Maintain and update a comprehensive database of diverse suppliers .

Generate reports and analyze data related to supplier diversity efforts, which may includ e spend analysis, supplier performance, and progress toward Live Nation’s D&I and procurement priorities .

Identify patterns, trends, and gaps that could inform discussions regarding future D&I initiatives and improvement opportunities by collecting, analyzing, aggregating, interpreting and reporting data from a variety of internal and external sources.

Regularly verify and validate supplier information to ensure accuracy and relevance.

Use data to develop fact-based reports on supplier diversity activity for senior leadership.

Develop and nurture relationships with local community partners and diverse supplier advocacy groups; facilitate interaction between these organizations and Live Nation’s geographically dispersed stakeholders.

Effectively represent Live Nation and Global Procurement in various settings with internal and external stakeholders.

Participate in outreach activities including conferences, diversity fairs, and other supplier diversity networking events to create awareness of Live Nation’s supplier diversity program and potential opportunities.

Additional duties as business needs arise .


WHAT THIS PERSON WILL BRING :

Bachelor’s degree in applicable field or equivalent experience required , graduate degree preferred .

3-5 years of experience in Strategic Sourcing, Procurement, Supplier Diversity, Data Analysis, or related field.

Knowledge of supplier diversity, strategic sourcing, and procurement functions, with experience working in a procurement role or with procurement professionals.

Strong analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret data to build consensus for recommendations.

Ability to work self-directed in a fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders.

Self-motivated, proactive, independent, and responsive – requires limited supervisory attention once objectives are confirmed.

A bility to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work effectively in a rapidly changing, highly decentralized environment .

Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, internal and external stakeholders.

Strong organizational and project management skills.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and applications such as MS Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Outlook .

Ability to travel up to 15% of the year

BENEFITS & PERKS

Our motto is ‘Taking Care of Our Own’ through 6 pillars of benefits:

HEALTH: Medical, Vision and Dental benefits for you and your family, including Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Health Savings Accounts (HSAs)

YOURSELF: Generous paid time off policy including paid holidays, sick time and paid days off for your birthday, Free concert tickets

WEALTH: 401(k) program with company match, Stock Program

FAMILY: New parent programs & support including caregiver leave and childcare cash, infertility support

CAREER: Tuition reimbursement, student loan repayment internal growth and development programs & trainings

OTHERS: Volunteer time off, crowdfunding network

Business Intelligence is a critical partner to NOV’s global operations, including locations in 61 countries. NOV’s supply chain supports manufacturing, service and support organizations across 6 continents. NOV engages in discrete, continuous process, batch production, project, job shop and outsourced manufacturing.

We accept BI Business Analysts with either relevant business or IT backgrounds. An ideal candidate will have both.

BI Business Analysts are expected to:

Act as primary liaison between business users and the BI developers, QA specialists and DBAs:
Gather business requirements for BI solutions, particularly ones related to supply chain, by meeting with key business users and technical experts
Translate business requirements into specifications for new solutions or changes to existing solutions
Validate BI solutions by comparing data sets, accessing source systems or conferring with business users

Prepare reports, presentations, procedures, specifications and process documents
Perform other work-related tasks as assigned
Comply with all NOV Company and HSE policies and procedures

Databases: Snowflake (primary data warehouse), Oracle, Microsoft, Incorta

Reporting Tools: Tableau, Cognos, Power BI, Sisense, Incorta

Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems or related area, or equivalent experience
Minimum 3 years’ experience working as an Analyst or in a Process Improvement role
Previous work experience with systems and processes in the manufacturing sector (preferably discrete manufacturing) or related area – in either a business user or an IT role
Strong written and verbal communication skills are required
Strong problem-solving skills are required
Experience working with reporting and dashboarding is required – in either a business user or an IT role
Experience with Snowflake, Tableau, Cognos and Power BI is desirable
Experience working with ERP systems is required, including experience with at least one of: Oracle Cloud, Oracle EBS or JD Edwards
Experience writing SQL queries is highly desirable
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and PC skills

At AES, we raise the quality of life around the world by changing the way energy works. Everyone makes an impact every day in our small, global teams. Apply here to start an extraordinary career today.
At AES, we are accelerating the future of energy, together, while transforming the customer experience and delivering outstanding products and solutions. We are looking for a Team Lead, Data Analytics (BESS), to report to the Manager of Structuring and Analytics (BESS) in the AES Clean Energy commercial business. The role will support the commercial platform in modeling and valuing Battery Energy Storage Systems, and partner with other business functions in Structured Origination, Term Trading, Structured Trading, Engineering, and Risk Management. Employees of varying experience are welcome to apply, and the role may be changed to accommodate differing experience levels.
This is a phenomenal opportunity to work toward a 100% carbon-free energy future, drive the business, build groundbreaking renewables experience, and grow with the team owning the energy transition.
Main Responsibilities


Lead development of battery dispatch model functionality as needed to support customer transactions, including innovative, first-to-market deal types.
Work with regulatory, engineering, market operations, and trading teams to improve modeling accuracy and adapt to changing market conditions.
Coordinate with members of the Commercial team to communicate model results and changes to broader AES partners.
Act as an internal subject matter expert in BESS project valuation and modeling, using model results to educate and coordinate with other teams across the AES CE business.
Support the AES Clean Energy deal pipeline with development of project revenue models for Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS).
Coordinate with Business Development, Mergers and Acquisitions, and Origination teams to ensure asset revenues and Power Purchase Agreements are adequately reflected within the investment due diligence process.
Deliver improvements and automation for existing battery dispatch models to shorten turnaround times and apply findings holistically to the business infrastructure.
Develop a deep understanding of commercial impacts affecting AES CE business, grow their own skills, contribute to building the wider team, and progress along the career path.
Qualifications
Extensive experience with US Wholesale power markets (ERCOT, CAISO preferred)
Knowledge of renewable and BESS asset revenue streams and their valuation.
Deep experience in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, R, MATLAB, C/C++), R and Python preferred.
Experience with optimization models and linear optimization.
Previous experience building production level models for power market.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, communication skills and attention to detail.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Engineering, Math, Physics, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar. Master’s Degree in those areas preferred.
3-4 years of relevant work experience in the energy industry in related functions such as trading, portfolio management, asset management, investment advisory, quantitative analytics, risk analytics and similar.

Job Title: Analyst - Data Systems- Doggett Corporate- Houston
Job Description:
Data Systems Analyst

As a member of the Corporate IT department, the Data Systems Analyst is responsible for the administration, development, integration and maintenance of our company's main Information Systems. The Data Systems Analyst participates in gathering business requirements and is responsible for delivering quality solutions and accurate results on a timely manner as well as managing tasks required for the daily operation and maintenance of our business systems. The Data Systems Analyst role requires a solid process and technical orientation, analytical, organizational and communication skills to assist in the resolution of complex issues as well as a strong personal accountability, initiative, flexibility and ability to work as a team.

Primary Responsibilities

Timely and effective resolution of business systems related projects, issues and requests.

Job Title: IT PROFESSIONAL – APPLICATIONS (Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst)
Job Description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

Applications Accepted From: ALL PERSONS INTERESTED
Job Classification: IT PROFESSIONAL – APPLICATIONS (Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst)
Posting Number: 32279
Department: HOUSTON INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES
Division: ENTERPRISE APPLICATIONS SERVICES
Reporting Location: 611 WALKER, Houston, TX 77002
Workdays & Hours: MONDAY – FRIDAY 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM* *Subject to Change

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES / ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Houston, TX, is the fourth largest city in the country, with a budget of over 6 billion dollars, a workforce strong of 20,000 employees, and 23 departments comprising fascinating data and a wide range of questions. Houston promotes healthy and resilient communities through smart civic investments, dynamic partnerships, education, and innovation. It is a place where anyone can prosper and feel at home.

The City offers its employees various benefits, including healthcare, wellness, professional development, a work-from-home policy (Download PDF reader), and an excellent pension plan (Download PDF reader). The Enterprise Data Office is part of the Houston IT Services department and provides city-wide services. Our four focus areas are Open Data, Data Community, Data Governance, and a Modern Data Stack.

The Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst plays a vital role in bridging the gap between raw data and actionable insights, helping departments make informed decisions to drive success by designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions. The Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst regularly provides guidance and training to both the line of business and IT team members.

The Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst will:
Discover insights by conducting data analysis to understand and uncover trends and patterns that can inform business decisions.
Design and create interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to convey insights to business stakeholders. Ensure that reports are user-friendly and accessible to non-technical users.
Implement data governance policies and security measures to safeguard sensitive information.
Develop data models, including dimensional models like star and snowflake schemas, to support efficient querying and reporting. Create, manage, and leverage data structures within data warehouses.
Collect and integrate data from various sources, such as databases, data warehouses, APIs, and external data providers. Ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy by cleaning and transforming data as needed.
Monitor and optimize the performance of BI solutions to ensure timely access to data and reports. Identify and resolve bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
Collaborate with business analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide data solutions.
Maintain documentation for data sources, pipelines, models, and reports to facilitate knowledge sharing and troubleshooting.
Stay updated with the latest BI technologies, best practices, and industry trends. Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement enhancements to BI systems.
Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use BI tools and understand the data provided.
Perform other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate possesses:
Proficiency with Power BI and data visualization tools in general, solid experience with DAX and M-Query.
Experience in working with databases and knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language) for writing queries to retrieve and manipulate data.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and using cloud data warehouses like Snowflake.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills for extracting meaningful insights from data, investigating issues, and proposing solutions.
Organizational skills to balance and prioritize projects and operational activities.
The ability to successfully communicate technical concepts to business stakeholders and provide instructions to users.
An aesthetic sense to create engaging and visually appealing reports that convey clarity and a coherent story to the audience.
A real business acumen to understand organizational objectives, an appetite to discover business processes, and an unyielding willingness to assist.

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is physically comfortable; the individual has discretion about walking, standing, etc. There are no major sources of discomfort in a normal office environment.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION
Requires a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management and Information Systems (MIS) or a closely related field.

Information systems-specific technical certifications may be substituted for 1 year of either the education or the experience requirement, as applicable.

Related professional Information Systems experience may be substituted for the education requirement on a year-for-year basis.

EXPERIENCE
At least five (5) years of technology experience supporting IT applications.

A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Management and Information Systems (MIS) or a closely related field may be substituted for two years of the experience requirement.


LICENSE
None

PREFERENCES

**Preference shall be given to eligible veteran applicants provided such persons possess the qualifications necessary for competent discharge of the duties involved in the position applied for, such persons are among the most qualified candidates for the position, and all other factors in accordance with Executive Order 1-6. **

Preference will be given to candidates with the following skillsets:
Supported mission critical reporting.
Experience in a DevOps environments or using an Agile Framework
Contributed to a cloud-based data warehouse.
Leverage Microsoft Azure Data Lake and Azure Data Factory as components of an ETL processes.
Demonstrated interest in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Foundational knowledge of SQL Server databases
Understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) or the ITIL framework
Related certifications

GENERAL INFORMATION

SELECTION / SKILLS TESTS REQUIRED
Department may administer skills assessment test.

SAFETY IMPACT POSITION – NO
If yes, this position is subject to random drug testing and if a promotional position, candidate must pass an assignment drug test.

SALARY INFORMATION
Factors used in determining the salary offered include the candidate’s qualifications as well as the pay rates of other employees in this classification.

PAY GRADE:26

APPLICATION PROCEDURES
Only online applications will be accepted for this City of Houston job and must be received by the Human Resources Department during active posting period. Applications must be submitted online at: www.houstontx.gov.

To view your detailed application status, please log-in to your online profile by visiting: http://agency.governmentjobs.com/houston/default.cfm or call (832) 393-0450.

If you need special services or accommodations, call (832) 393-0450. (TTY 7-1-1). If you need login assistance or technical support call 855-524-5627.

Due to the high volume of applications received, the Hiring Department will contact you directly, should you be selected to advance in our recruitment process.

All new and rehires must pass a pre-employment drug test and are subject to a physical examination and verification of information provided.

About Us

Cornerstone Building Brands is a premier exterior building solutions provider serving both the residential and commercial markets across North America. The building products we manufacture are the cornerstone of the communities where people live, work and play -from homes to hospitals, grade schools to grocery stores, manufacturing facilities to municipal buildings and beyond.

Through the core values and consistent behaviors and mindsets embraced by our employees, we have built a culture dedicated to understanding our customers' needs and what matters most to their success. We know that it's our people that make the difference and we are deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized, providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and team members.

Job description

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As the Marketing Data Analyst, you will be responsible for in-depth reporting on marketing, e-commerce and customer technology activities, providing insights on revenue attribution, campaign performance, and user adoption across a range of mediums and platforms. You will gather, analyze, interpret and present marketing and sales data to inform marketing decisions, optimize campaigns, improve customer segmentation, and advance predictive analytics capabilities. Through analytical and data storytelling skills, this strategic role enables our marketing team to make smarter, better, and faster decisions to improve the customer experience and increase market share.

This position has a virtual-first hybrid work arrangement with a preferred location in Houston, TX with a minimum of two days a week in the office or co-located with other team members.

Collects and analyzes data from various sources, including digital marketing campaigns, website analytics, social media platforms, customer surveys, e-commerce platforms, sales data and market research reports to identify and present strategic useful insights
Centralizes and maintains all marketing and customer technology analytics and reports
Works closely with Sales Operations and Analytics Center of Excellence (ACE) to integrate marketing data into data structures for the broader company
Guides third party agencies on reporting standards, structure and formats as needed to aggregate into centralized reports
Guide necessary data integrations between our marketing and sales platforms, involving complex data workflows
Assist with analytics implementation QA, documentation, and optimization
Manage the tag management, working with marketing managers and agency to ensure the correct implementation and set up of all of our required tags within Google Tag Manager
Implement and maintain marketing data governance standards, ensuring accuracy and completeness of data within reports and dashboards
Take ownership of data-related problems and drive the resolution process; coordinates with the IT department on data-related technical issues
Monitors and measures performance of online and offline campaigns, evaluating metrics related to website traffic, lead generation, conversion rates, customer engagement, brand awareness, and product interest
Translates complex metrics into concise reports, dashboards, and presentations to inform and guide strategy
Develops visual reports consumable for key stakeholders to inform our current and future marketing initiatives
Crafts monthly, quarterly and annual reports for marketing and business unit leadership measuring important metrics across earned, owned and paid media efforts
Collaborates with Corporate Marketing and Sales Enablement stakeholders to gather data, perform analysis, synthesize results, and deliver key insights; ensures consistency in data definitions and sources
Reports on marketing KPIs like leads, conversion rates, website traffic and social media engagement
Develop and implement analytical models to understand customer behavior and optimize marketing strategies
Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance our marketing and customer technology efforts
Analyzes marketing and sales funnel performance and customer intent based on customer behavior, incorporating both first and multi-touch source attribution
Reports on marketing KPIs including leads, conversion rates, website traffic and social media engagement to create transparency to ROI
Create and advance marketing forecast and prediction models using multi-year performance trends
Integrates insights from multiple projects, campaigns and platforms into more strategic insights
Conduct competitive research and analyze benchmarking data to identify new market opportunities, target audiences, and consumer behavior patterns
Supports marketing budget analysis and forecasting, making recommendation based on insights to future marketing investments
Identify, evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to enhance and mature marketing tracking and reporting capabilities
Share best practices with others and promote cross-functional learning.
All other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business, statistics, mathematics, social sciences, marketing, or a similar field
A minimum of 5-7 years of experience collecting, analyzing and reporting on data sourced from sales and marketing platforms such as CRM, marketing automation platforms like Eloqua, and Google Analytics
In-depth understanding of digital marketing and e-commerce campaign strategies and tactics such as SEM, merchandising, PPC and programmatic advertising
Proficiency with computer programs, such as MS Excel, Access, and PowerPoint
Comprehensive understanding of full marketing and sales funnels, including familiarity with lead maturation processes
Expertise in data visualization and BI tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc
Additional information

Why work for Cornerstone Building Brands?

Our teams are at the heart of our purpose to positively contribute to the communities where we live, work and play. Full-time* team members receive** medical, dental and vision benefits starting day 1. Other benefits include PTO, paid holidays, FSA, life insurance, LTD, STD, 401k, EAP, discount programs, tuition reimbursement, training, and professional development. California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) of 2018

Notice of Recruitment Fraud

We have been made aware of multiple scams whereby unauthorized individuals are using Cornerstone Building Brands name and logo to solicit potential job-seekers for employment. In some cases, job-seekers are being contacted directly, both by phone and e-mail. In other instances, these unauthorized individuals are placing advertisements for fake positions with both legitimate websites and fabricated ones. These individuals are typically promising high-paying jobs with the requirement that the job-seeker send money to pay for things such as visa applications or processing fees. Please be advised that Cornerstone Building Brands will never ask potential job-seekers for any sort of advance payment or bank account information as part of the recruiting or hiring process.

Overview:
Who We Are
Hicuity Health is the leader in delivering expert telemedicine care in support of patients and bedside care teams in acute and critical care environments. Since our founding in 2006, Hicuity Health has pioneered provider-to-provider telemedicine, fueling success with clinical and technical innovation.

What We're Solving
Hicuity Health leverages telemedicine to address clinical needs and staffing shortages for a diverse range of clients and care venues nationwide, including health systems, hospitals, post-acute care facilities, and at-home acute care environments.

Our Mission
For nearly two decades, Hicuity Health has delivered “Care Innovated” to its clients and patients. Across a range of services, Hicuity offers clinical, technical, and operational expertise that improves patient care and supports healthcare facilities nationwide.

The Role
As the leading high acuity telemedicine provider in the United States, we are seeking a highly motivated and talented individual to join our team of high performing Clinical Support professionals as the Data Specialist. The Data Specialist performs a variety of both complex and routine clinical support duties. Coordinates with clinical team members as appropriate, in collecting information for clinicians to coordinate treatment strategies and to facilitate the remote treatment of patients. Abstracts clinical data from multiple clinical information systems, and accurately enters data into the eCareManager Application (eCM), ensuring accuracy and completeness.

This position works out of our Operations Center located in Houston, TX.


You Will:
Assists in the management of patient information across Hicuity Health Operation Center locations.
Consistently verifies patient census for assigned client hospitals.
Enters information appropriate for new admissions
Retrieves patient data from hospital’s systems and enters it in eCM with speed and efficiency.
Completion of Care Plan data points needed for Best-Practices and APACHE scoring
Provide direct support to clinical staff in the monitoring center with the clinical use of eCM.
Assists client hospitals with the use of eCM when necessary.
Demonstrates attention to detail with accurate, timely and complete data entry and retrieval.
Answers, prioritizes and directs phone calls in the Hicuity Health Operation Centers.
What We Are Looking For:
What We’re Looking For
High School diploma or equivalent.
Knowledge of medical terminology and laboratory data required.
Past experience as a patient care technician, hospital unit secretary is desirable.
Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills
Demonstrates dependability, reliability and flexibility.
Proficiency with Windows-based computer skills, telephone and fax operations.

As Part Of Our Team, Team Members Receive
Hicuity Health fuses a friendly and collegial work environment with high performance standards.
Our compensation plans include:
Base salary
Generous shift differentials

Business Analyst

Primary Duties:

Identify new business opportunities and propose new technical solutions that could increase business value and provide new avenues of revenue.
Coordinate technical requirements between business and engineering teams to integrate new solutions.
Identify missing business functionalities within the existing multi-service architecture and propose new business and technical solutions.
Develop strategies to promote the team’s adherence to regulations and performance goals, while meeting the business requirements.
Build experiments to explore previously unused datasets and identify trends and patterns that could help improve targeted business advertising and save costs.
Model customer trends data using the scientific approach to increase business value and revenue.
Design and implement automated data processing pipelines and integrate it into existing microservice architecture.
Implement core statistical models using python and utilize multiple languages to gather datasets from different services.
Monitor and maintain existing production models and classifiers to identify false positives, bugs, and resource utilization.
Provide technical specifications for new data analysis projects, and work with multiple teams to gather the necessary data, choose the right data modeling structures to meet business requirements.
Design and implement enhanced reporting systems to aggregate data from various services to validate current business models, and to identify any potential issues and bottlenecks.
Identify trends and opportunities through new technologies to improve departmental processes and systems and providing recommendations on solutions.
Provide technical support for the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders internally and externally within the company and its various suppliers.
Formulate new methods to collect and process data sets in large volumes, identify anomalies and prepare the datasets for various business research.
Provide quality customer service when interacting with existing and potential suppliers, addressing potential solutions, and ensuring any and all conflicts are resolved as quickly as possible.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, Management Information Systems, or a similar related field of study. Master’s degree in any of these fields is a plus.

Detail orientated with excellent time management skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with involving MS Visio, Enterprise Architect, Operations Management, Requisite Pro, Decision Support Systems, Supply Chain Management, UAT, UML, and Business Process Re-engineering, is required.

The main function of a business systems analyst is to analyze science, engineering, business and all other data processing problems for application to electronic data processing systems. A typical business systems analyst is responsible for analyzing user requirements, procedures and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow and scheduling limitations.

Gather requirements from business units and translate those to programmers and developers.
Confer with clients regarding the nature of the information processing or computation needs.
Prepare cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation.

Expand or modify system to serve new purposes or improve work flow.

Who we are
Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

The Escrow Analyst I Specialist will be responsible for reviewing and completing escrow analysis in accordance with RESPA (Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act) for all escrow loans and non-escrow loans with negative escrow advances. Perform all duties in accordance with the company guidelines, applicable federal, state, and local regulations.

Responsibilities:
Perform daily Ad-Hoc escrow analysis for the portfolio – including the review of escrow line detail, and preliminary shortage and overage reports to clear all exceptions for a final analysis that is compliant with RESPA Regulations.
Solves problems rapidly and cost-effectively with minimal disruption.
Perform monthly bulk escrow analysis for the portfolio following the Mass State Schedule
Research illogical collection amounts, due dates, or large changes in payment
Document findings by adding notes to the loan
Complete the steps to process the escrow analysis and create a change in monthly payment
Process requests received from the mortgage holder, clients, or other departments
Monitor work volumes and adjust work types or production to meet department needs
Maintain consistent attendance to ensure fulfillment of essential duties and responsibilities.
Qualifications/Skills:
Minimum of 1+ years residential mortgage loan servicing experience.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Outlook).
Detail oriented with excellent organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Possess excellent communication (written and verbal) and customer service skills.
Ability to effectively and accurately communicate with all levels within the organization.
Proven ability to work well both independently and as a team member.
Ability to make sound decisions based upon department, company policies, procedures, knowledge and experience.
Onbase imaging system experience a plus.
Knowledge of SQL (Preferred but not required).
Flexible to changing priorities, project scopes, and deadlines.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, not required or equivalent mortgage experience
